meanings.sent1: The exoduses of birds in the fall are a sight to behold.
meanings.sent2: The exoduses of refugees from war-torn countries are heart-wrenching.
meanings.sent3: The exoduses of ants from the picnic blanket made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The exoduses of stars from the night sky left it dark and empty.
meanings.sent5: The exoduses of students from the classroom signaled the end of the school day.

meanings.definition: A going out; a departure or emigration, usually of a large number of people.
meanings.sent1: The exoduses of shoppers from the mall on Black Friday were chaotic.
meanings.sent2: The exoduses of families from the city during the holidays create traffic jams.
meanings.sent3: The exoduses of ducks from the pond caused a ripple effect in the water.
meanings.sent4: The exoduses of thoughts from her mind made her feel lost.
meanings.sent5: The exoduses of workers from the office at 5 pm were a daily occurrence.
